meanings.sent1: The skellums in the neighborhood always played pranks on each other.
meanings.sent2: She knew he was a skellums when he tried to trick her into believing a tall tale.
meanings.sent3: The skellums thought it would be funny to hide all the cookies in the jar.
meanings.sent4: His smile was as sly as a skellums plotting their next scheme.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the skellums lurking in the shadows, waiting to cause trouble.

meanings.definition: To behave in a mischievous or deceitful manner.
meanings.sent1: The children decided to skellums around the house, moving things just out of reach.
meanings.sent2: He would often skellums by pretending to be sick to avoid doing his chores.
meanings.sent3: She would skellums by leaving fake notes for her friends to find.
meanings.sent4: The fox seemed to skellums through the forest, always one step ahead of the hunters.
meanings.sent5: The cat would skellums around the room, knocking things off the shelves just for fun.
